snippet: Rorie had tried to chase him, but in vain ; madness lent a new vigour to his bounds ; he sprang from rock to rock over the widest gullies ; he scoured like the wind along the hill-tops ; he doubled and twisted like a hare before the dogs ; and Rorie at length gave in ; and the last that he saw, my uncle was seated as before upon the crest of Aros.
